meanings.sent1: She whoofed out the candles on her birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The wind whoofed through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent3: The dragon whoofed out a puff of smoke from its nostrils.
meanings.sent4: The train whoofed steam as it pulled out of the station.
meanings.sent5: He whoofed a sigh of relief after finishing his exam.

meanings.sent1: The hungry child whoofed down his dinner in minutes.
meanings.sent2: She whoofed the ice cream before it melted in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon whoofed the berries from the bush in a frenzy.
meanings.sent4: The students whoofed the snacks during the break between classes.
meanings.sent5: He whoofed the sandwich as if he hadn't eaten in days.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden loud noise, as in a dog barking
meanings.sent1: The dog whoofed loudly at the mailman approaching the house.
meanings.sent2: A distant thunder whoofed in the dark clouds above.
meanings.sent3: The old car whoofed and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks whoofed in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The lion whoofed a warning to the intruding hyenas.
